meanings.definition: To bully someone in a more aggressive or forceful manner than others.
meanings.sent1: The bigger kids were outbullying the smaller ones on the playground.
meanings.sent2: She was outbullying her classmates to get what she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a tiny mouse outbullying a lion in a story seems funny.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice outbullying the noise of the traffic.
meanings.sent5: The storm outbullying the gentle breeze, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: The act of intimidating or harassing someone in a way that is more extreme than usual.
meanings.sent1: The outbullying from the group made him feel scared and alone.
meanings.sent2: She faced outbullying at school every day.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a tiny ant trying outbullying a giant elephant is amusing.
meanings.sent4: The outbullying of the storm clouds over the peaceful sky.
meanings.sent5: The outbullying behavior of the bullies left a lasting impact on the victim.
